What book is The movie All I Desire based on?

The movieAll I Desire is based on the bookThe Headlandwritten by  Carol Ryrie Brink

The Headland(A Novel) 1/1/1955

Chronicles the lives of a circle of family and friends through summers on the French coast as they share childhood, love,and the tragedies of World War II.

Related books / From the author(s)

The Headland

written byCarol Ryrie Brink

1/1/1955

Chronicles the lives of a circle of family and friends through summers on the French coast as they share childhood, love,and the tragedies of World War II.

Caddie Woodlawn

written byCarol Ryrie Brink

Published by Simon and Schuster - 6/19/2012

An illustrated edition of the Newberry Medal–winning Caddie Woodlawn, which has been captivating young readers since 1935. Caddie Woodlawn is a real adventurer. She'd rather hunt than sew and plow than bake, and tries to beat her brother's dares every chance she gets. Caddie is friends with Indians, who scare most of the neighbors—neighbors who, like her mother and sisters, don't understand her at all. Caddie is brave, and her story is special because it's based on the life and memories of Carol Ryrie Brink's grandmother, the real Caddie Woodlawn. Her spirit and sense of fun have made this book a classic that readers have taken to their hearts for more than seventy years.

Snow in the River

written byCarol Ryrie Brink

Published by Atheneum - 1/1/1964

This novel has interest...in the picture it gives of the western white pine forests and efforts to protect them against exploitation when the United States was young (1890s) and just beginning to realize that its wealth of natural resources was not inexhaustible....

Stopover

written byCarol Ryrie Brink

1/1/1951

An adult novel that recounts the pleasures and heartaches of aging actress Naomi Murdoch's return to the unforgiving Minnesota town and family she left years earlier.

Mademoiselle Misfortune

written byCarol Ryrie Brink

1/1/1936

Fourteen-year-old Alice Moreau, "Mademoiselle Misfortune," enjoys a grand adventure touring France as traveling companion to the elderly American tourist, Miss Weatherwax, and brings some good fortune to her own family.

Did you know that the movie All I Desire is based on the book The Headland?

In 1900, Naomi Murdoch deserted her small-town family to go on the stage. Some ten years later, daughter Lily invites Naomi back to see her in the Riverdale high school play. Her arrival sets the whole town abuzz, wakes up old conflicts, and sets off new emotional storms.

  • Internet Movie Database:  7.1/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes:  100%
